focus_skills: Systems of 2 linear equations in 2 variables
Inference from sample statistics and margin of error

questions.question: The function <math><mi>f</mi></math> is defined by <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>14</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation: Substitute <math><mn>5</mn></math> for <math><mi>x</mi></math> in the equation: <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>14</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn></math>. Calculate the product: <math><mn>14</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>70</mn></math>. Then add <math><mn>9</mn></math> to get <math><mn>79</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When evaluating a function, simply replace the variable in the parentheses with the given number and follow the order of operations.

questions.question: If <math><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>n</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Divide both sides by <math><mn>2</mn></math> to get <math><mi>n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math>. Add <math><mn>3</mn></math> to both sides to find <math><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: You can check your answer by plugging it back into the original equation: 2(9-3) = 2(6) = 12.

questions.question: A bag contains <math><mn>6</mn></math> red marbles, <math><mn>4</mn></math> blue marbles, and <math><mn>8</mn></math> green marbles. If one marble is selected at random, what is the probability that it is blue?
questions.explanation: The total number of marbles is <math><mn>6</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>18</mn></math>. The number of favorable outcomes (blue marbles) is <math><mn>4</mn></math>. The probability is <math><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>18</mn></mfrac></math>, which simplifies to <math><mfrac><mn>2</mn><mn>9</mn></mfrac></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Probability is always (Favorable Outcomes) / (Total Outcomes). Always check if the fraction can be simplified.

questions.question: A rectangular swimming pool has a length of <math><mn>20</mn></math> feet and a width of <math><mn>15</mn></math> feet. What is the area, in square feet, of the surface of the pool?
questions.explanation: The area of a rectangle is calculated as <math><mi>length</mi><mo>×</mo><mi>width</mi></math>. Calculating <math><mn>20</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>15</mn></math> results in <math><mn>300</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Don't confuse area (multiplication) with perimeter (addition).

questions.question: A landscaping company charges a fee modeled by the equation <math><mi>C</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>45</mn><mi>h</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>80</mn></math>, where <math><mi>C</mi></math> is the total cost in dollars and <math><mi>h</mi></math> is the number of hours worked. What does the value <math><mn>45</mn></math> represent in this context?

options.B: The total cost for one day of work
options.C: The hourly rate charged for labor
options.D: The maximum number of hours the company will work

questions.explanation: In the linear equation <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></math>, the slope <math><mi>m</mi></math> represents the rate of change. Here, <math><mn>45</mn></math> is the coefficient of <math><mi>h</mi></math> (hours), so it represents the cost per hour, or the hourly rate.
questions.score_improvement_tip: In linear models, the coefficient of the variable (slope) is usually a rate (per unit), while the constant term (y-intercept) is a starting value or flat fee.

questions.question: Which of the following graphs in the xy-plane represents the solution to the inequality <math><mi>y</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></math>?

options.A: A solid line with slope 2 and y-intercept 1, shaded above.
options.B: A dashed line with slope 2 and y-intercept 1, shaded above.
options.C: A dashed line with slope 2 and y-intercept 1, shaded below.
options.D: A solid line with slope 2 and y-intercept 1, shaded below.

questions.explanation: The inequality is <math><mi>y</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></math>. The boundary line is <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></math>. Because the inequality is strict (<math><mo><</mo></math>), the line must be dashed. Because <math><mi>y</mi></math> is less than the expression, the shaded region must be below the line.
questions.explanation_chart_svg: <svg width="400" height="400" viewBox="-10 -10 20 20" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" aria-labelledby="chart-title"><title id="chart-title">Graph of the inequality y < 2x + 1</title><defs><pattern id="hatch-pattern" patternUnits="userSpaceOnUse" width="0.5" height="0.5" patternTransform="rotate(45)"><line x1="0" y1="0" x2="0" y2="0.5" stroke="#0074d9" stroke-width="0.1" opacity="0.4"/></pattern></defs><g transform="scale(1, -1)"><g class="grid" stroke="#dddddd" stroke-width="0.05"><line x1="-10" y1="-8" x2="10" y2="-8"/><line x1="-10" y1="-6" x2="10" y2="-6"/><line x1="-10" y1="-4" x2="10" y2="-4"/><line x1="-10" y1="-2" x2="10" y2="-2"/><line x1="-10" y1="2" x2="10" y2="2"/><line x1="-10" y1="4" x2="10" y2="4"/><line x1="-10" y1="6" x2="10" y2="6"/><line x1="-10" y1="8" x2="10" y2="8"/><line x1="-8" y1="-10" x2="-8" y2="10"/><line x1="-6" y1="-10" x2="-6" y2="10"/><line x1="-4" y1="-10" x2="-4" y2="10"/><line x1="-2" y1="-10" x2="-2" y2="10"/><line x1="2" y1="-10" x2="2" y2="10"/><line x1="4" y1="-10" x2="4" y2="10"/><line x1="6" y1="-10" x2="6" y2="10"/><line x1="8" y1="-10" x2="8" y2="10"/></g><g class="axes" stroke="black" stroke-width="0.1"><line x1="-10" y1="0" x2="10" y2="0"/> <line x1="0" y1="-10" x2="0" y2="10"/> </g><polygon points="-10,-10 10,-10 10,21 -10,-19" fill="url(#hatch-pattern)" /><line x1="-6" y1="-11" x2="5" y2="11" stroke="#001f3f" stroke-width="0.15" stroke-dasharray="0.3, 0.3"/><circle cx="0" cy="1" r="0.2" fill="#001f3f" /> <circle cx="-0.5" cy="0" r="0.2" fill="#001f3f" /> </g><g font-family="sans-serif" font-size="0.8" fill="black"><text x="9" y="1">x</text><text x="0.5" y="-9">y</text><text x="1" y="-0.8" font-size="0.6">(0, 1)</text><text x="-3.5" y="0.5" font-size="0.6">(-0.5, 0)</text><text x="-9" y="-8" font-size="1" font-weight="bold" fill="#001f3f">y < 2x + 1</text></g></svg>
questions.explanation_chart_description: The graph shows the solution on the xy-plane. A dashed line with slope 2 passes through (0,1). The region below the line is shaded.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Use the 'Test Point' method. Plug in (0,0). Is 0 < 2(0) + 1? Yes, 0 < 1. So the region containing (0,0) must be shaded.

questions.question: The graph of the function <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></math> is shown in the xy-plane. Which of the following could be the equation for <math><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='400' viewBox='-10 -10 20 20' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><line x1='-10' y1='0' x2='10' y2='0' stroke='black' stroke-width='0.2'/><line x1='0' y1='-10' x2='0' y2='10' stroke='black' stroke-width='0.2'/><path d='M -2 -13 Q 2 19 6 -13' stroke='black' stroke-width='0.3' fill='none' transform='scale(1, -1)' /><text x='2' y='-4' font-size='1' font-family='sans-serif'>(2, 3)</text><circle cx='2' cy='3' r='0.2' fill='black' transform='scale(1, -1)'/></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A parabola opening downward with its vertex at the coordinates (2, 3).
questions.explanation: The vertex form of a quadratic is <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>h</mi><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>k</mi></math>, where <math><mo>(</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>)</mo></math> is the vertex. The chart shows the vertex at <math><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></math>, so <math><mi>h</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> and <math><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. The parabola opens downward, so <math><mi>a</mi></math> must be negative.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Remember: Inside the parentheses is opposite (x - 2 means right 2), outside is same (+ 3 means up 3).

questions.question: The scatterplot shows the relationship between variables <math><mi>x</mi></math> and <math><mi>y</mi></math>. A line of best fit is also shown. Based on the line of best fit, which of the following is closest to the predicted value of <math><mi>y</mi></math> when <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></math>?
questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='400' viewBox='-2 -2 14 14' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><style>.axis { stroke: black; stroke-width: 0.1; } .grid { stroke: lightgray; stroke-width: 0.05; } .line { stroke: blue; stroke-width: 0.15; } .point { fill: black; } .text { font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 0.5px; text-anchor: middle; } .label { font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 0.6px; font-weight: bold; }</style><line x1='0' y1='10' x2='10' y2='10' class='grid' /><line x1='0' y1='8' x2='10' y2='8' class='grid' /><line x1='0' y1='6' x2='10' y2='6' class='grid' /><line x1='0' y1='4' x2='10' y2='4' class='grid' /><line x1='0' y1='2' x2='10' y2='2' class='grid' /><line x1='0' y1='0' x2='10' y2='0' class='grid' /><line x1='0' y1='0' x2='0' y2='10' class='grid' /><line x1='2' y1='0' x2='2' y2='10' class='grid' /><line x1='4' y1='0' x2='4' y2='10' class='grid' /><line x1='6' y1='0' x2='6' y2='10' class='grid' /><line x1='8' y1='0' x2='8' y2='10' class='grid' /><line x1='10' y1='0' x2='10' y2='10' class='grid' /><line x1='0' y1='0' x2='0' y2='10' class='axis'/><line x1='0' y1='10' x2='10' y2='10' class='axis'/><text x='-0.8' y='10.2' class='text'>0</text><text x='-0.8' y='8.2' class='text'>2</text><text x='-0.8' y='6.2' class='text'>4</text><text x='-0.8' y='4.2' class='text'>6</text><text x='-0.8' y='2.2' class='text'>8</text><text x='-0.8' y='0.2' class='text'>10</text><text x='0' y='11' class='text'>0</text><text x='2' y='11' class='text'>2</text><text x='4' y='11' class='text'>4</text><text x='6' y='11' class='text'>6</text><text x='8' y='11' class='text'>8</text><text x='10' y='11' class='text'>10</text><text x='5' y='12.5' class='label'>x</text><text x='-1.5' y='5' class='label' transform='rotate(-90, -1.5, 5)'>y</text><line x1='0' y1='2' x2='10' y2='7' class='line'/><circle cx='2' cy='3' r='0.15' class='point'/><circle cx='4' cy='4' r='0.15' class='point'/><circle cx='6' cy='4.5' r='0.15' class='point'/><circle cx='8' cy='6' r='0.15' class='point'/></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A scatterplot with a downward sloping line of best fit. The x-axis ranges from 0 to 10. The line starts near y=8 at x=0 and passes through approx y=4 at x=8.
questions.explanation: Locate <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></math> on the horizontal axis. Move vertically up to the line of best fit. From that point on the line, look across to the vertical y-axis. The point on the line corresponds to <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>.
questions.explanation_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='400' viewBox='-2 -2 14 14' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><style>.axis { stroke: black; stroke-width: 0.1; } .grid { stroke: lightgray; stroke-width: 0.05; } .line { stroke: blue; stroke-width: 0.15; } .point { fill: black; } .text { font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 0.5px; text-anchor: middle; } .label { font-family: sans-serif; font-size: 0.6px; font-weight: bold; }</style><line x1='0' y1='10' x2='10' y2='10' class='grid' /><line x1='0' y1='8' x2='10' y2='8' class='grid' /><line x1='0' y1='6' x2='10' y2='6' class='grid' /><line x1='0' y1='4' x2='10' y2='4' class='grid' /><line x1='0' y1='2' x2='10' y2='2' class='grid' /><line x1='0' y1='0' x2='10' y2='0' class='grid' /><line x1='0' y1='0' x2='0' y2='10' class='grid' /><line x1='2' y1='0' x2='2' y2='10' class='grid' /><line x1='4' y1='0' x2='4' y2='10' class='grid' /><line x1='6' y1='0' x2='6' y2='10' class='grid' /><line x1='8' y1='0' x2='8' y2='10' class='grid' /><line x1='10' y1='0' x2='10' y2='10' class='grid' /><line x1='0' y1='0' x2='0' y2='10' class='axis'/><line x1='0' y1='10' x2='10' y2='10' class='axis'/><text x='-0.8' y='10.2' class='text'>0</text><text x='-0.8' y='8.2' class='text'>2</text><text x='-0.8' y='6.2' class='text'>4</text><text x='-0.8' y='4.2' class='text'>6</text><text x='-0.8' y='2.2' class='text'>8</text><text x='-0.8' y='0.2' class='text'>10</text><text x='0' y='11' class='text'>0</text><text x='2' y='11' class='text'>2</text><text x='4' y='11' class='text'>4</text><text x='6' y='11' class='text'>6</text><text x='8' y='11' class='text'>8</text><text x='10' y='11' class='text'>10</text><text x='5' y='12.5' class='label'>x</text><text x='-1.5' y='5' class='label' transform='rotate(-90, -1.5, 5)'>y</text><line x1='0' y1='2' x2='10' y2='7' class='line'/><circle cx='2' cy='3' r='0.15' class='point'/><circle cx='4' cy='4' r='0.15' class='point'/><circle cx='6' cy='4.5' r='0.15' class='point'/><circle cx='8' cy='6' r='0.15' class='point'/><line x1='8' y1='10' x2='8' y2='6' stroke='red' stroke-width='0.1' stroke-dasharray='0.2'/><line x1='8' y1='6' x2='0' y2='6' stroke='red' stroke-width='0.1' stroke-dasharray='0.2'/><circle cx='8' cy='6' r='0.2' fill='red'/></svg>
questions.explanation_chart_description: The original graph with a red dashed vertical line going up from x=8 to the regression line, and a horizontal line going left to y=4.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Always read from the line of best fit, not the nearest data point, when asked for a 'predicted' value.

questions.question: In a right triangle, one leg measures <math><mn>5</mn></math> units and the hypotenuse measures <math><mn>13</mn></math> units. What is the length of the other leg?
questions.explanation: Using the Pythagorean theorem <math><msup><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>c</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>: <math><msup><mn>5</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>13</mn><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. This simplifies to <math><mn>25</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>169</mn></math>. Subtracting 25 gives <math><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>144</mn></math>, so <math><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Memorize common Pythagorean triples like 3-4-5, 5-12-13, and 8-15-17 to save calculation time.

questions.question: The population of a town increased from <math><mn>8,000</mn></math> to <math><mn>8,400</mn></math> in one year. What was the percent increase in the population?
questions.explanation: Percent increase is <math><mfrac><mi>Difference</mi><mi>Original</mi></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mn>100</mn></math>. The difference is <math><mn>8,400</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>8,000</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>400</mn></math>. Dividing by the original: <math><mfrac><mn>400</mn><mn>8,000</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></math>. Multiplying by 100 gives <math><mn>5%</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Always divide the change by the *original* (starting) number, not the final number.

questions.skill: Systems of 2 linear equations in 2 variables
questions.question:
Consider the system of equations below, where <math><mi>k</mi></math> is a constant.
<math><mi>k</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math>
<math><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></math>
If the system has no solution, what is the value of <math><mi>k</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: For a system of linear equations to have no solution, the lines must be parallel, meaning their slopes must be equal (or the ratio of x-coefficients to y-coefficients must be the same, but the constants different). Ratio of y-coefficients is <math><mfrac><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.6</mn></math>. Ratio of x-coefficients is <math><mfrac><mi>k</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math>. Setting them equal: <math><mfrac><mi>k</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>0.6</mn><mo>→</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.4</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For 'no solution', set the ratios of x and y coefficients equal: a1/a2 = b1/b2.

questions.question: A linear function <math><mi>f</mi></math> models the growth of a sapling. The model predicts the height was <math><mn>15</mn></math> inches when <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math> months, and <math><mn>35</mn></math> inches when <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></math> months. What is the predicted height, in inches, when <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: First find the slope (rate of growth): <math><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>35</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>20</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. The equation is <math><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></math>, so <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi></math>. For <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></math>, <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>50</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Calculate the slope first. This represents the unit rate, which allows you to extrapolate values.

questions.question: For the linear function <math><mi>g</mi></math>, <math><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math> and <math><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation: Since <math><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math>, the y-intercept <math><mi>b</mi></math> is <math><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. Use the second point to find slope <math><mi>m</mi></math>: <math><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>(</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math>. Solving for <math><mi>m</mi></math>: <math><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>→</mo><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. The function is <math><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. Then <math><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>14</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When g(0) is given, you instantly know the y-intercept. This simplifies finding the equation.

questions.question: A substance decays such that the amount remaining decreases by <math><mn>15</mn><mo>%</mo></math> every hour. If the initial amount was <math><mn>200</mn></math> grams, which equation models the amount <math><mi>A</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></math> remaining after <math><mi>t</mi></math> hours?
questions.explanation: Exponential decay is modeled by <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mi>r</mi><msup><mo>)</mo><mi>t</mi></msup></math>. Here <math><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>200</mn></math> and <math><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.15</mn></math>. The base becomes <math><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>0.15</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0.85</mn></math>. So, <math><mi>A</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>200</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>0.85</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mi>t</mi></msup></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: If something decreases by a percentage, multiply by (100% - percent). If it increases, multiply by (100% + percent).

questions.question: Which expression is equivalent to <math><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mi>x</mi></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></math> for <math><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: To add fractions, find a common denominator, which is <math><mi>x</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. The expression becomes <math><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When adding rational expressions, always multiply the top and bottom of each fraction by the factor missing from its denominator.

questions.question: How many real solutions does the equation <math><mn>3</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> have?
questions.explanation: Use the discriminant <math><msup><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>a</mi><mi>c</mi></math>. Here <math><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>, <math><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>, <math><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>. <math><msup><mn>5</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>48</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>23</mn></math>. Since the discriminant is negative, there are zero real solutions.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Positive discriminant = 2 solutions. Zero discriminant = 1 solution. Negative discriminant = 0 real solutions.

questions.skill: Inference from sample statistics and margin of error
questions.question: A researcher estimates that <math><mn>42</mn><mo>%</mo></math> of a city's residents support a new law, with a margin of error of <math><mn>3</mn><mo>%</mo></math> at a <math><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></math> confidence level. Which of the following is the most appropriate conclusion?

options.A: Exactly 42% of residents support the law.
options.B: There is a 95% chance that between 39% and 45% of residents support the law.
options.C: At least 45% of residents support the law.
options.D: It is plausible that the true percentage of support is 40%.

questions.explanation: The margin of error implies the true value likely falls between <math><mn>42</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>39</mn><mo>%</mo></math> and <math><mn>42</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>45</mn><mo>%</mo></math>. Choice D (40%) lies within this interval. Choice B is technically incorrect terminology ('chance' vs confidence in the method), and A/C are too definitive.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Margin of error creates an interval (Estimate - MOE to Estimate + MOE). The true population parameter is likely within this interval.

questions.question: The equation of a circle in the xy-plane is <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. What is the radius of the circle?
questions.explanation: Complete the square for x: <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>25</mn></math>. For y: <math><mo>(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>9</mn></math>. The equation becomes <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>36</mn></math>. Radius is <math><msqrt><mn>36</mn></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: To complete the square for x^2 + bx, add (b/2)^2 to both sides of the equation.

questions.question: In triangle <math><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></math> below, line segment <math><mi>D</mi><mi>E</mi></math> is parallel to <math><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></math>, with <math><mi>D</mi></math> on <math><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></math> and <math><mi>E</mi></math> on <math><mi>A</mi><mi>C</mi></math>. If <math><mi>A</mi><mi>D</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></math>, <math><mi>D</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>, and <math><mi>D</mi><mi>E</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math>, what is the length of <math><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></math>?
questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><polygon points='200,50 100,250 300,250' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='133' y1='183' x2='267' y2='183' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><text x='195' y='45' font-size='15'>A</text><text x='90' y='265' font-size='15'>B</text><text x='305' y='265' font-size='15'>C</text><text x='120' y='180' font-size='15'>D</text><text x='270' y='180' font-size='15'>E</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Triangle ABC with a horizontal line segment DE cutting across the middle. A is the top vertex. D lies on side AB and E lies on side AC. DE is parallel to base BC.
questions.explanation: Triangles <math><mi>A</mi><mi>D</mi><mi>E</mi></math> and <math><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></math> are similar. The ratio of sides is <math><mfrac><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>D</mi><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>. <math><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mi>D</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>D</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math>. So, <math><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>6</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>6</mn><mrow><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>. Cross-multiply: <math><mn>4</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>36</mn></math>, so <math><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When a line is parallel to a triangle base, it creates a smaller similar triangle. Always compare the small triangle's side to the *total* large triangle's side.

questions.question: What is the sum of the solutions to the equation <math><msqrt><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math>?
questions.explanation: Square both sides: <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><msup><mo>)</mo><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></math>. Rearrange: <math><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Factor: <math><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. Potential solutions: <math><mn>5</mn></math> and <math><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math>. Check <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math>: <math><msqrt><mn>4</mn></msqrt><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math> but <math><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math>, so <math><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> is extraneous. The only valid solution is <math><mn>5</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Always check for extraneous solutions when squaring both sides of an equation involving variables.
